casebody.data:
Anonymous. A certiorari to remove an indictment may be granted by a judge of the Supreme Court at chambers. H. Stockton

stated that he wished to obtain a certiorari -to remove an indictment, but was not prepared to move for it at this time, and wished to know if it could be granted by a judge at chambers.

*The Chief Justice

said the certiorari could be [*3 allowed by a judge at chambers. Such had been the construction given to the act; and the court had no doubt it was the proper construction.
